sen.j: 広幡 基豊（ひろはた もととよ、寛政12年4月22日 (旧暦)（1800年5月15日） - 安政4年5月29日 (旧暦)（1857年6月20日））は、江戸時代後期の公卿。
sen.e: Mototoyo HIROHATA (May 15, 1800 - June 20, 1857) was a court noble in the latter Edo Period.
sen.cmt: 公卿→ここでは官位ではなく社会的ステータスを指していると考え、一般名称としてのcourt nobleを使いました。下記、官位についての文章では公卿→the top court official（s）としました。
sen.e: Mototoyo HIROHATA (May 15, 1800 - June 20, 1857) was a court noble during the latter Edo Period.
Mototoyo HIROHATA (May 15, 1800 - June 20, 1857) was a court noble during the late Edo Period.

sen.j: 主に光格天皇（119代）・仁孝天皇（120代）・孝明天皇（121代）の三朝にわたり仕えた。
sen.e: He mainly served three successive emperors, Emperor Kokaku (the hundred nineteenth Emperor), Emperor Ninko(the hundred twentieth Emperor), and Emperor Komei(the one hundred twenty-first Emperor).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。

sen.j: 官位は従一位内大臣まで昇った
sen.e: The highest official rank he achieved was Juichii (Junior First Rank) Naidaijin (Minister of the Center).

sen.j: 母は大納言日野資矩の娘（内大臣今出川実種の養女）。
sen.e: His mother was the daughter of Dainagon (chief councilor of state) Suketsune HINO.

sen.j: 妻は鷹司政煕の娘・皐子。

sen.j: 子に貴族院議員広幡忠礼侯爵、水無瀬経家、娘に鋭姫（徳川慶篤室）、四条隆平室がいる。
sen.e: A member of Kizokuin (the House of Peers) Marquis Tadaaya HIROHATA and Tsuneie MINASE were his sons, and Princess Eihime (Yoshiatsu TOKUGAWA's wife) and Takahira SHIJO's wife were his daughters.

sen.j: 清華家当主として速いスピードで昇進し、文化 (元号)10年（1813年）には従三位となり、公卿に列する。
sen.e: For a head of the Seiga family, his promotion was rapid, and in 1813 he was raised to Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) and admitted as one of Kugyo (the top court officials).
For a head of the Seiga family, his promotion was rapid, and in 1813 he was raised to Jusanmi (Junior 3rd Rank) and admitted as one of Kugyo (top court officials).

sen.j: その後も中納言・踏歌節会外弁・大納言・踏歌節会内弁などを務め、弘化4年（1847年）に皇太后となった鷹司祺子の皇太后宮大夫となる。
sen.e: After holding the positions of Chunagon (vice-chief councilor of state), Toka no sechie Geben (a Kugyo who supervised many matters outside Jomei Gate at Toka no sechie (Imperial Court Ceremony)), Dainagon (chief councilor of state), Toka no sechie Naiben (a Kugyo who supervised many matters inside Jomei Gate at Toka no sechie (Imperial Court Ceremony, which was taken place on May 16)) and others, and he was appointed to Kotaigogu no daibu (master of the Empress Dowager's Household) to Yasuko TAKATSUKASA, who became Empress Dowager in 1847.
sen.cmt: 踏歌節会内弁→Toka no sechie Naiben (a Kugyo who supervised many matters inside Jomei Gate at Toka no sechie (Imperial Court Ceremony, which was taken place on May 16))としました。

sen.j: 嘉永2年（1849年）に右近衛大将・右馬寮御監となる。
sen.e: In 1849 he became Ukone no daisho (major captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards) and Umaryo gogen (inspector of the Right Division of Bureau of Horses).

sen.j: 安政2年（1855年）の孝明天皇の遷幸に際しては基豊は居飼2名、随身6名、見寺2名、舎人長1名、馬副8名、傘1名の計20名を集めて天皇に供奉した。
sen.e: At the time of Emperor Komei's departure from the capital in 1855, he escorted the Emperor, forming a entourage made up of two ikai (stablemen), six zuishin (guards), two midera (見寺), a tonericho (chief of stableman), eight umazoi (horse attendants), and one kasamochi (umbrella bearer).
